tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley and Thomas Oriti bring you the latest on phase one of the Gaza ceasefire deal, nationwide March for Palestine rallies, plus the days news, politics, global affairs, culture, weather, and sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Gideon Haigh, Rana Hussain and Daniel Cherny discuss the Womens ODI World Cup, the build up to the Ashes and the latest AFLW news.

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: The concept of soulmates has been around for centuries. But does the notion that just one person can meet all of our emotional, sexual and spiritual needs still hold? Siobhan Marin meets people living beyond monogamy.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Topiary Tips and Native Orchids
programme.desc: Costa discovers the art of topiary, Clarence explores a stunning collection of native orchids, Hannah dives into a pool converted to a frog pond, Millie plants root crops, and we visit a beautiful Italian-inspired homestead.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Semi-retired couple Garry and Fiona Learmonth are moving from Auckland to the small rural community of Loburn on the North Canterbury plains where they plan to build a home designed by Garry and modelled on a Stealth Bomber.

programme.title: In My Blood It Runs
programme.desc: Told through the eyes of charismatic 10-year-old Arrernte/Garrwa boy Dujuan and his family, the film charts the challenges Dujuan faces both in his school and on the streets of Alice Springs.

programme.title: The Art Of Starting Over
programme.desc: How do we start over when life takes us back to square one? Guest host Osher Gunsberg seeks answers from ex-Wiggle Emma Watkins, AFL legend turned painter Gavin Wanganeen and comedian Sam Kissajukian.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Endeavour persists undeterred with the investigation at Blenheim Vale, before the death of a uniformed copper sends shockwaves through Castle Gate.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: Dale and Michael embark on a project to restore two 19th Century timber cottages on their Tasmanian rural property. Will they accomplish their dream?

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The roadshow goes to one of the grandest, historic houses in Wales, Powis Castle.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Who will accept the Big Brass Mug from Tom Gleeson... and who will be sent OUT!? On the Hard Quiz podiums are self-nominated experts in Kate Bush, Bratz dolls, Kakadu National Park and The Goodies!

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: In her first in-depth interview since her fathers death, former tennis star Jelena Dokic opens up about the years of abuse she suffered at his hands and how she rebuilt her life.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Australias leading forum for media analysis and comment. Host Linton Besser, a four-time Walkley award-winning investigative reporter and former foreign correspondent, brings you a fearless critique of the weeks journalism.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: Black Saturday Bushfires. Saturday 7 February 2009. I Was Actually There collects personal stories from survivors, first responders and community members who faced the catastrophe.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Award-winning broadcaster Virginia Trioli explores the essence of creativity with some of our best loved artists at the peak of their powers. Virginias first guest is literary sensation Trent Dalton.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Ggsp Icymi: Ori and The Will Of The Wisps
programme.desc: We dive back into some of the best bits of GGSP, just In Case You Missed It! We review the epic platforming masterpiece Ori and The Will Of The Wisps, DARREN walks us though how motherboards work, and the PAX 2019 expo!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: What would happen if Shadow Moth created a fearsome supervillain while Marinette and Adrien couldnt transform into Ladybug and Cat Noir?

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A two-part cliff-hanger where everything that Shaun knows and loves comes into question, when he impulsively makes a wish and must face up to some unexpected consequences.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: The teachers are back at Willard R. Abbott Public School for development week.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors test a theory to see if they can find out why skin goes wrinkly in the bath, Dr Chris meets a patient taking part in ground-breaking heart research, and test the power of your eyes in todays mind-bending trick.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: To recover a missing package, the Bears get help from Ranger Tabes, an eccentric forest ranger. But her overblown sense of justice might be too much for the Bears to handle.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Shadow Moth creates Sentibubbler, a fearsome Sentimonster that will only stop if Rena Rouge betrays Ladybug and Cat Noir! Will our heroes pass this trust test?

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Starfires new pet is a horribly dangerous parasite.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Two alien kids land at the farm one night and run riot. Can Shaun and Bitzer stop them before they wake the Farmer?

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides a group of medical students through the game - but will the pressure of the mighty maze turn their bright minds to mush?

programme.title: Mythbusters: Theres Your Problem!
programme.desc: Delving into the science of animal behaviour, the MythBusters kick off this episode with a risky romp into a crocodile pit.

programme.title: rage From The Diaphragm Special
programme.desc: For those in the back, rage lines up clips from the most powerful pipes in Australian music, from Tina Arena to Kate Ceberano, Jessica Mauboy and more.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway?
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler hosts another episode of the legendary improv show featuring regulars Wayne Brady, Ryan Stiles and Colin Mochrie along with guest performer Brad Sherwood and star guest Cedric The Entertainer.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Inner truths are revealed at Addies first ever sleepover. But when Jenna asks awkward questions about Miss Murphy, Keedie clams up. In the 16th century a jail break is planned.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.desc: Goku continues to surprise Beerus with his growing powers. As their fight escalates, the universe manages to stay intact, but for how long? Then, Goku reverts back to a Super Saiyan! Have his godly powers run out?

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: When Ques ghostly face goes viral, Charlie is ready to cash in on her fame. But Pierce fears what all this exposure could lead to.

programme.title: Ninjago Dragons Rising
programme.desc: Lloyd and Wyldfyre lead the escaped dragons in a battle against the Claws while Sora and Arin search for Riyu in hopes of shutting down the Photacs.

programme.title: Gangnam Project
programme.desc: ASTRA are questioning if theyre on the right path, but when Ken reveals that a group member has decided to leave, everyone must work together to convince them to stay.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Breakstep Bridge / Row Skiing / Toothbrush Surprise
programme.desc: Can you destroy a bridge using just the rhythm of marching feet? Is there more in toothbrush bristles than meets the eye? And Jamie and Adam test the myth of human horsepower.

programme.title: Sharon and Ozzy Osbourne: Coming Home
programme.desc: This intimate documentary follows the final three years of Ozzys life as he and Sharon plan a return home after 25 years in LA, and prepare for the ultimate farewell gig.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The Harpers get a free holiday to Lanzarote. Although Ben loses his luggage, he is delighted to still have his brand new digital camera. Everyone soon wishes it were the other way around.

programme.title: Nick Cave and Warren Ellis At Hanging Rock
programme.desc: Featuring new and classic songs, this epic live show celebrates the profound relationship that Australian music legends Nick Cave and Warren Ellis have developed with their audience over four decades.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Its the day of Addies performance, but theres even more drama behind the scenes as Emilys jealousy reaches breaking point. With Maggie in prison, Elinor plans a daring rescue.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: This Is All The Power Ive Got! A Settlement Between Gods
programme.desc: Goku continues the hard fought battle, but his powers still arent enough to take down the God of Destruction. When his energy finally runs out, Earths fate is sealed! Or is it? The battle of the gods reaches its end!

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Haunted by the memory of his recently departed pet, Pierce suspects it may be responsible for ghostly activity in the walls of Helsings house.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Rosemary Riddle
programme.desc: Ezra is grumpy when his visiting Nanna interrupts his detective work until she unexpectedly gives the Inbestigators a case to crack.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When the beach is taken over by the most excellent Bro Sharks, will the Girls be gnarly enough to save the day?

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy meets the kids at the beach to explore rock pools and see the plants and animals that live in them. The team use jars to collect water and bits of seaweed from the ocean and observe the plankton and microorganisms.

programme.title: Mini Lessons
programme.desc: In this lesson, you will learn about probability using percentages and decimals. Ms Szalek explains percentages, and then she explains how to convert expected and actual probability outcomes into decimals.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets a cheese salesman transforming a horse trailer into a cheese stall, and a man hoping to set a world record for the smallest campervan. Finally, Georges garden build is revealed. (Final)

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The series celebrating ingenious small space builds returns. George meets a couple who bought the wreck of a private jet and a gypsy tattoo artist who hopes to turn an old railway carriage into a home.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Hollie England, Giancarlo Scalia, Francis Menotti and Gabriel Werlen.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Mr Onion is riding on the Bumparoller when he discovers a great big hole in the road. What are we going to do? Mr Onion knows how to fix it!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.sub-title: Beep And Mort Make A Movie
programme.desc: After seeing Beeps filming abilities, Mort and Pop are inspired to make a movie. Mort discovers that showbiz is tougher than he thought.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Zap decides he wants to walk on the moon and Bop builds him a set of wings, but they dont seem to work. Zaps friends decide if they cant get Zap to the moon they can bring the moon to Zap.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: When Mole is unsure of a coming storm, the Sound Collector comforts her with sound.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are visiting Daddy Pigs office. Daddy works with Mr Rabbit and Mrs Cat. Mr Rabbits job is all about numbers, Mrs Cats job is all about drawing shapes on the computer, and Daddy Pigs job is.. complicated.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock hear the enticing tunes of an ice cream van approaching and quickly hatch a plan to divert it into their field. While the driver seeks help, the Flock have great fun with an endless supply of ice cream.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: In the perilous plant aisle, Supertato and Evil Pea team up to find treasure as they have half a map each, but she tricks him and steals the map to find the treasure for herself.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadora wants to perform ballet at the Vampire Talent Show, but worries it unvampirey.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Katya learns that even helpful witches need help when her magic causes chaos at the library, while Frankies wand mishap brings carousel horses to life in a fun-filled adventure!

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore wetlands to find frogs! They discover tadpoles, see how frogs grow and change, and explore their powers like sticky tongues, big eyes, and colour-changing skin!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Sodor Sings Together
programme.desc: In preparation for the big Sodor Sings Festival - the biggest musical event on the - the engines are hard at work to make the night one to remember.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Four and Two attend a Shape Party in Flatland, meeting various 2D shapes along the way.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mrs Zebra teaches Peppa, George, Zoe, Zaza and Zuzu Zebra how to make a real tea set from clay.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie offers to babysit her little brother while Mom works on her laptop, Millie struggles to keep him occupied.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Everyone wants Stanleys help. Myrtle to make pancakes, Jose to unpack boxes, Peggy to tidy her tree house and Ari to do groovy moves for the dance class. Stanley invents three Can Bots to help.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets are planning an epic surprise pool party for Phillipas birthday but when things get out of hand, they forget the golden pool rule: keep the gate shut.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps his friend Ace overcome his fear of animals so that he can compete in the Super Stunt Rally.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Ben misses out seeing his favourite comic book artist and a miniature model of the Gauntlet of Doom, Millie and Maya recreate the gauntlet for him.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the kids are inspired by a mural in a community garden by a local French artist, Hugues Sineux. They paint pots and add plants to complement the artwork and make the green space even more beautiful.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: The Biggest Muddy Puddle In The World
programme.desc: Peppa and George wake up one morning to find that all the rain has made a flood, and their house is now a desert island!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Professor Natquik excitedly returns to his den for a relaxing vacation, but he arrives to find a red fox has moved in! Both refuse to budge until a snow storm locks them both in.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Playing Butterflies in the backyard is great fun, until Bluey runs away with Judo leaving Bingo all alone. Now poor Bingos heartbroken and Bluey needs to make amends.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar watch a pride of lions in the safari park and the super-sized mountain chicken frog, which has a surprising connection to the lions.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, each of the friends decides to give Lily Plant some pretend water. Everybody loves Lily Plant, Lily Plant loves pretend water, what a lovely day for Lily Plant!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: After forgetting Maes birthday, the villagers join forces to throw her a surprise party for the ages with some help from a very unreliable Russell.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Jango pretends to be a genie and grants Bop a wish in exchange for a basket of apples, but how is Jango going to make Bops wish come true?

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector finds a lost teddy bear, and tries to help.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Cocos Hula Hoop. Its harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig and Granny Pig are taking Peppa, George and their friends on a boat trip to Pirate Island. Grandpa uses his metal detector to find treasure and they all build a big sandcastle. The children love Pirate Island.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When Shauns old friend the Alien drops by for a loo break, Shaun is only too happy to let him use the facilities in the farmhouse. While hes going about his business he leaves Shaun in charge of his intriguing new gadget.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Which team will win Malcolms Wildlife Photo Challenge - Mandy and Mike, Sarah and James, Hannah and Joe, or Norman and Jodie?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly takes some frogspawn home from class to look after, but is surprised when the frogspawn has turned into tadpoles by morning. Soon there are lots of little frogs for Holly to look after!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: There is a new friend for Peppa at her playgroup, Lotte Lama. She can speak a foreign language. Peppa loves talking, everyone loves talking!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma tries to impress her zoologist hero when dinosaur bones are discovered on Kangaroo Beach. But what sort of dinosaur do they belong to?

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Frankie and friends help Mr. Mash conquer stage fright with teamwork, creating a magical and memorable talent show.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Anniversary
programme.desc: When Nikhil and Jay try to help Appa and Amma surprise each other for the anniversary of their first date, things quickly get out of hand!

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie, Nina and Akil go to the woods to make a den. They learn about planning a project and the teamwork to make it happen.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can you create swirling patterns on liquid surfaces? In this experiment, Alex uses dish soap, food dye and milk to create some swirly-twirly art.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Hey, diddle diddle! Its pandemonium at the Alphablocks animal sing-song. This episode has fun with the words cat, dog, cod, tag, jog, jig, mop, moo, moon, spoon and zoom.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: The Biggest Muddy Puddle In The World
programme.desc: Peppa and George wake up one morning to find that all the rain has made a flood, and their house is now a desert island!

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Miles loses his Rowdy Robot toy during a trip to the park, its up to Millie to find it!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Fifi asks Stanley to help them find a Mermaid so they can take its picture for school. With the help of Little Woo, the explore in Stanleys new submarine in search for the illusive Mermaid

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma tries to impress her zoologist hero when dinosaur bones are discovered on Kangaroo Beach. But what sort of dinosaur do they belong to?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sonny is trying to prove himself to be a useful engine so that he can stay working on Sodor, but nobody seems to trust him... nobody apart from Diesel, that is! But can Diesel be trusted?

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the junior gardeners make pots so magical; they disappear into the garden!

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Explore music from around the world and learn with The Wiggles! Visit Athens with Lucia, travel to the Philippines with John, and stop by Ethiopia with Tsehay!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Drac struggles to learn a new dance routine but, with the Super Monsters support, learns its okay to make mistakes and that persistence leads to success.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to visit a house that Mr Bull is building. Who will their new neighbours be?

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Robot wants to be a "hero robot" and "stop Romeo". Gekko decides to help him by training him but what sort of hero will he make Robot be?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington accidentally destroys a squirrels nut store so invites him in to apologise, however he didnt expect him to bring friends.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato, Carrot and Tomato are exploring in the plant aisle when they hear a strange noise. They follow the noise and meet the famous Kiwi the Explorer, who needs their help.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey plays mum to a brood of bouncy balloons, including an irrepressible floater named Greenie. But she soon discovers that mothering is much harder than she imagined.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley and Thomas Oriti bring you the latest on phase one of the Gaza ceasefire deal, nationwide March for Palestine rallies, plus the days news, politics, global affairs, culture, weather, and sport with Jared Coote.

programme.desc: Black Saturday Bushfires. Saturday 7 February 2009. I Was Actually There collects personal stories from survivors, first responders and community members who faced the catastrophe.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Award-winning broadcaster Virginia Trioli explores the essence of creativity with some of our best loved artists at the peak of their powers. Virginias first guest is literary sensation Trent Dalton.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Hundreds of court cases including child abuse and sexual offences under review as police examine work by an officer in regional Victoria. Plus drought-stricken SA hit with a potato shortage leaving supermarket shelves bare.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong with the news from Asia: At least 19 children die after consuming toxic cough syrup in India, hundreds of trekkers rescued from a blizzard on the Tibetan side of Mt Everest, plus Japan set for its first woman PM.

programme.title: Aussie Mavericks
programme.desc: The outback and cattle station life can be hard and unforgiving. And for one woman it offered a life of adventure and opportunity. But dont even think about calling her just managers wife.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: We speak to Isabella Higgins about the rights and responsibilities of reporting from war zones, the importance of telling the stories of those affected, and how it helps hold governments and military powers to account.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.sub-title: Trump makes peace in the Middle East, but will he win the Nobel Prize?
programme.desc: Donald Trump has helped secure a peace deal in Gaza. Is the Nobel Peace Prize on the cards? Plus Jules and Jez talk about the first female Archbishop of Canterbury, Dame Sarah Mullally, who now leads 85 million Anglicans.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Hundreds of court cases including child abuse and sexual offences under review as police examine work by an officer in regional Victoria. Plus drought-stricken SA hit with a potato shortage leaving supermarket shelves bare.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers joins Waleed Aly, Melissa Clarke and Paul Sakkal to discuss the week in parliament, Optus and the Triple Zero outage, Liberal Party turmoil, plus John Lyons and Matthew Doran with latest on the ceasefire in Gaza.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Miriam Corowa presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Miriam Corowa presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Miriam Corowa.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: Dog Gone - The Hunt for Valerie
programme.desc: How the hunt for runaway sausage dog Valerie fired up the Kangaroo Island community and sparked headlines around the world.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Lisa Millar ventures to one of Tasmanias oldest and most celebrated woodchopping carnivals, Henley-on-Mersey. Its here she learns how generations of axemen and women are keeping this iconic Aussie sport alive. (Final)

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Gold glitters for investors: how a flight to safety is smashing records for the precious metal. Plus paying off a mortgage into your 70s, the new normal for older borrowers in a hot property market. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The Riverinas golden opportunity for tourism; Kelpie pups helping sick country kids; Flying-in for a footy grand final with views of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre; and vale artist William Robinson.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers joins Waleed Aly, Melissa Clarke and Paul Sakkal to discuss the week in parliament, Optus and the Triple Zero outage, Liberal Party turmoil, plus John Lyons and Matthew Doran with latest on the ceasefire in Gaza.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: Swedish authorities suspect a Russian Orthodox church of being a spying hub for the Kremlin. Plus the artistic mosaics on Portugals streets are a trademark, but they have hidden dangers.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Travel influencers have been promoting tours of Afghanistan, despite government warnings not to travel there. We look at how the country has changed under Taliban rule and why visiting is controversial.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The Riverinas golden opportunity for tourism; Kelpie pups helping sick country kids; Flying-in for a footy grand final with views of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre; and vale artist William Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best original reporting. Melissa Mackay brings you news, interviews and analysis on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: In our fast-moving world, we unpack the latest in politics, shifting national affairs and the global events shaping our lives. Guest host Melissa Clarke asks the tough questions on the big issues to the key decision makers.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.
